questions.question: Which command most directly prints a non-interactive snapshot summary of total, used, and free physical memory in human-readable units?
Which command is most effective for a continuous, real-time inspection of overall memory pressure and swapping behavior on a Linux server?
You want to know how full the root filesystem '/' is in terms of disk usage. Which command is best suited for this?
Which command is the most robust way to follow a log file, showing new lines as they are written, even if the file is renamed or rotated by the logging service?
You suspect '/var' contains some huge files. Which command pipeline will list the 10 largest files or directories under '/var' in human-readable form?
Which tool is designed to provide a real-time, interactive display of disk I/O utilization per process, similar to 'top' for CPU?
A filesystem is reported as 100% full. You delete a huge log file, but 'df -h' still shows the filesystem as full. What is the most likely cause?

options.text: The log file is still held open by a running process.
The filesystem journal needs to be manually flushed.
There is a kernel bug in the filesystem driver.
You must run 'sync' after every 'rm' for space to be freed.

questions.question: Which single command pipeline will show the last 100 lines of a gzipped log file, '/var/log/app.log.gz', without modifying the file?
Which command-line utility is specifically designed to list all open files (including network sockets, pipes, and descriptors) for a process with PID 1234?

A process on Linux suddenly becomes very slow and CPU-bound. Which utility would give a quick, real-time breakdown of where the process is spending its time, specifically sampling the instruction pointer?
To view real-time CPU utilization and load average, which command should you run to get a continuous update every 2 seconds?
Which of the following metrics found in 'vmstat' is the best indicator of a system suffering from CPU starvation due to competition in a virtualized environment?
Which command is the appropriate way to check for the current usage of inodes on the '/home' filesystem?
You need to find a single file over 500MB in size, anywhere under the root directory '/'. Which command is best for this task?
Which command is used to display a hierarchical tree structure of all mounted filesystems, including partitions, in a way that shows their parent-child relationships?
When monitoring disk I/O with 'iostat', which metric represents the average size (in kilobytes) of the requests that were issued to the device?
You want to view only the top 5 largest directories in the current working directory, excluding individual files. Which command pipeline achieves this efficiently?
What is the primary purpose of the 'sar -W 1' command?

options.text: Report the I/O wait time of the CPU.
Report disk utilization and transfer rates.

questions.question: If you are trying to unmount a busy filesystem, which utility can help you find the process(es) that are currently using the filesystem resource?
When monitoring I/O with 'iostat -x', a persistently high value for '%util' (close to 100%) on a device is a strong indication of what?

options.text: The device is approaching an I/O bottleneck and is saturated.
The device is performing many sequential reads.
The device has a very long average I/O service time.

questions.question: Which of the following 'grep' commands will match lines that contain either 'ERROR' or 'FATAL' in a log file?
Which command-line tool is best suited for replacing all occurrences of the string 'old_value' with 'new_value' within a file directly (in place)?
What is the primary function of the 'head -n -5' command?

options.text: Display the last 5 lines of the input.
Display all lines of the input *except* the first 5 lines.
Display all lines of the input *except* the last 5 lines.
Display the first 5 characters of each line.

questions.question: You have a log file where the timestamp is the first field and a message is the fourth field. Which 'awk' command will print only the timestamp and the message, separated by a comma?
Which command would you use to get a count of the number of lines containing the word 'login' in the 'secure.log' file?

options.text: awk '/login/ { COUNT++ } END { print COUNT }' secure.log

questions.question: Which command would you use to view the first 20 lines of a compressed BZ2 file named 'data.csv.bz2' without decompressing it?
You need to find the number of unique IP addresses in the 6th field of a web server log file. Which combination of utilities is most effective?
Which 'find' command option can be used to execute a command on the files that are found, such as changing their permissions?
To view the contents of a file that has been compressed using the 'gzip' utility, but you only want to see the first 50 lines, which command is most efficient?
Which option for 'tail' is used to output data starting from the specified line number, rather than counting from the end of the file?
Which of the following signals can be used with the 'kill' command to terminate a process gracefully, allowing it to clean up before exiting?
Which process monitoring command is generally recommended as the modern and improved alternative to 'netstat' for network diagnostics?
To find all processes running under the username 'www-data', which option for the 'ps' command is best combined with 'grep'?
A process has become a 'zombie' (defunct). What is the necessary action to remove the zombie process entry from the process table?

options.text: Use 'kill -9' on the zombie process PID.
Kill or restart the parent process of the zombie process.

questions.question: Which 'ss' command options should be used to list all TCP sockets that are currently in the 'LISTEN' state?
Which 'ps' command output (BSD syntax) includes the '%MEM' and '%CPU' columns, which are missing in the default System V syntax ('ps -ef')?
You need to change the niceness value (priority) of a currently running process with PID 555 to a lower priority (higher niceness value). Which command is correct?
Which command is primarily used to monitor and trace system calls made by a process?
Which of the following describes the key information presented by the 'load average' metric (the three numbers) reported by 'uptime' and 'top'?

options.text: The average CPU utilization over the last 1, 5, and 15 minutes.
The total I/O wait time over the last 1, 5, and 15 minutes.
The average number of processes in the runnable state or waiting for disk I/O over the last 1, 5, and 15 minutes.
The average amount of free physical memory over the last 1, 5, and 15 minutes.

questions.question: To list all network connections to the local host on port 80 (HTTP) that are listening or established, which 'ss' native filter would capture both?
